title: Software Engineer
summary: Developing the backend for an autonomous AI agent, focusing on scalable document processing, advanced RAG techniques, and system observability.

items.description: Engineered advanced **RAG strategies** (hybrid search, query expansion) and implemented **system observability** using OpenInference to maximize retrieval accuracy and provide deep visibility into agent reasoning.
Developed a robust **document processing pipeline** to ingest, chunk, and index documents, supporting multi-tenancy and efficient data retrieval.

title: AI Engineer
summary: Built AI-driven code tools, creating a knowledge graph algorithm with a scalable processing system. Developed the backend to integrate LLMs and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for a production-ready code assistant. Led the full infrastructure migration and created an on-premise solution to meet enterprise data privacy needs.

items.description: Engineered a **knowledge-graph algorithm** to analyze codebase structures. You can try it out at [deepgraph.co](https://www.deepgraph.co/).
Designed a scalable, asynchronous system to build knowledge graphs by orchestrating **dynamic AWS ECS tasks**, enabling on-demand processing of any size codebase.
Architected the **Deno API backend** to integrate multiple LLMs with internal tools, serving a production-scale code assistant.
Developed the core logic for **autocomplete** and **code indexation** features within the VS Code extension, including building the **MCP** client.
Architected a **containerized on-premise Docker solution**, unlocking a new enterprise customer segment by guaranteeing 100% data privacy.
Led the **full infrastructure migration from Vercel to AWS**, rebuilding the platform on **AWS Fargate** to improve scalability and reduce operational costs.
Deployed a **Qwen coder model on Google Cloud** with GPU autoscaling, providing inline code completions to free users while optimizing inference costs.

title: Data Scientist
company: Data Science Institute, Universidad del Desarrollo
summary: Analyzed massive mobile datasets to create a national "mobility index", which was directly used by the Chilean government to inform lockdown policies. For enterprise clients, I developed a recommendation system to drive cross-sales and implemented Bayesian models for Customer Lifetime Value and journey analysis.

items.description: Developed a national **"mobility index"** by analyzing massive mobile XDR datasets in BigQuery, which **directly informed Chilean government lockdown policies** and led to 2 peer-reviewed publications.
Developed a **recommendation system** for Derco-Chile to **drive cross-sales** by matching users with similar vehicles.
Implemented **Customer Lifetime Value and Customer Journey models using Bayesian inference** for Derco-Chile, helping in the development of new products and services.

title: Research Assistant
company: National Astronomical Observatory, University of Chile
summary: Developed an Approximate Bayesian Computation algorithm as part of my Master's thesis to characterize Blazar variability, cutting model fitting time from hours to minutes. Also contributed to the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) project by acquiring data and performing redshift classification.

items.description: Developed a novel **Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) algorithm** to characterize Blazar variability, **reducing model fitting time from hours to minutes**.
Contributed to the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) project by acquiring data and performing **redshift classification**.

title: Developer
summary: Developed and published tsnmf, a Scikit-Learn compatible Python package for Topic-Supervised NMF optimized for sparse matrices. This package served as the core model in a published study on city-wide transportation mode inference.

items.description: Developed and published [tsnmf](https://github.com/Vokturz/tsnmf-sparse), a **Scikit-Learn compatible Python package** for Topic-Supervised NMF **optimized for sparse matrices**, used as the core model in a [published study on city-wide transportation mode inference](https://epjdatascience.springeropen.com/articles/10.1140/epjds/s13688-018-0177-1).
